text:
A poorly executed, 'ticking the boxes' holiday flick falling flat whenever it attempts to build any form of tension, romantic or otherwise. 

Bella is a flat, uninspired and hollow protagonist with neither edges nor flaws, nor any character development to speak of. With the exception of her relationship status, she ends the movie as she started it. That lack of character is, fundamentally, what contributes to any sort of chemistry between Bella and the Duke.

It would be expected that at least her male counterpart would undertake some sort of character development, but no. "Duke Stefan Brown" has himself very little in the way of character to develop; at the very least, he came pre-packaged with an unpleasant breakup and a tragic family history. And while, to his credit, he does change over the course of a very, very long 1.5 hours, that change is formulaic rather than earned. There are no profound or emotionally charged moments - character development is told and explained, not shown or felt.

The story does precious little to change any of that. The plot is expectedly predictable, and not without a bit of Christmas spirit in the shape of a surprisingly gracious paparazzo. Fortunately, in this case, that also means it takes no suprising turns, making it an entirely inconsequential piece of holiday entertainment.

Add to that an overall cheap and tacky feel - visibly dirty floors, cheap-looking suits, an overabundance of all-too-obviously-fake fake snow, not the faintest touch of believable royalty - and rapid, jumpy cuts in conversations. Then sprinkle in every cliché imaginable, and you're left with a film that feels disjointed and uninspired for much of its runtime.

The saving grace here is low expectations: You don't start this film expecting a masterpiece, so the disappointment doesn't hit all that hard. There is almost a feeling of relief once the credits roll.
Horrible.  I found the lead lady terribly annoying.
Wonderfully terrible! Wooden acting (especially male lead) and his British (?) accent is awful! He sounds like he’s taking the piss!

Filme: Um Amor Real de Natal				Assistido: 28-12-24
Elenco: @damonrun @danicamckellar @vpapavs @goodman.patrice 
Modelo: #natal #romance 
Duração: 1h 27m 	Ano: 2023
Minha opinião: Um filme natalino já conhecido o roteiro. De um nobre com Rapunzel ou Ciderela ou gata Borralheira. E aqui é este conto de Natal que vimos já uma dezena de vezes e que não se cançamos de assistir em todo período de Natal. Temos uma repórter que vai fazer um trabalho com duque e onde o amor florece. Onde o coração gélido do duque vai descongelando e descongelando. E o amor no final brilha. Com boa fotografia natalina o filme corre como um filme B ou C. Com interpretações medianas. Com final feliz.
Roteiro e enredo já conhecido. E que mantém o espirito natalino. 
Vale apena assistir? Sim no Natal.
Nota: Filme: A) 5 B) 7 C) 8

Chemistry lacking between these two and those embracing moments were hard to watch , in fact those were the only strong emotions I had for the movie....Bella needed to relax more for the right romantic connection on screen
This movie had a lot of potential but the story is told at a very fast pace and the royalty portrayed is very b-tec. How come a prince flies in Wizz Air…

Very sweet. That's about it.
It suffers from being wildly two dimensional.

Be heart warming, be humouress, but be something.

I watched this Christmas movie on friendly TV. Great American family. If you like good family movie watching you can't go wrong with great American family. Unlike a lot of the Hallmark Movies, Now that they have gotten so family unfriendly. Danica, McKellar and Damon Runyon did an excellent job in mass. Yes I highly recommend it James Welch, Henderson Arkansas November 25, 2023.
